body_html:
Seems like a technically sound strategy, but maybe there is an alternative that is more straightforward for users?

I don't know the internals of StagingArea but perhaps feeding full records directly to that, pulling out the result, then returning might be enough so loading will be fast and users can do as they please with the returned results?

Perhaps the easiest thing to do is I could add a comment recommending users just read the high performance models guide before using. :-)
body_text:
Seems like a technically sound strategy, but maybe there is an alternative that is more straightforward for users?
I don't know the internals of StagingArea but perhaps feeding full records directly to that, pulling out the result, then returning might be enough so loading will be fast and users can do as they please with the returned results?
Perhaps the easiest thing to do is I could add a comment recommending users just read the high performance models guide before using. :-)
body:
Seems like a technically sound strategy, but maybe there is an alternative that is more straightforward for users?

I don't know the internals of `StagingArea` but perhaps feeding full records directly to that, pulling out the result, then returning might be enough so loading will be fast and users can do as they please with the returned results?

Perhaps the easiest thing to do is I could add a comment recommending users just read the [high performance models guide](https://www.tensorflow.org/performance/performance_models) before using. :-)
